page.title: 06LEWSEY PARK AREA
page.content: Lewsey park is one of the largest{open {areas}in Luton.A little stream runs through it which soon becomes the River Lea.{Fairs}come to the park sometimes and there are swings and roundabouts for young children.Also on the park is an{indoor swimming pool and a{squash club.}There are{football {pitches}which are very busy on a Sunday. There are{primary schools}on two sides of the park, St Martin de Porres,which is Roman Catholic and Ferrars Junior and Infant school.On the other edge of the park,high on an embankment is the{M.1.Motorway,}which is very noisy. On the last side of the park is Pastures Way, which is the edge of a large{council estate}called Lewsey Farm.Recently built on the park is a{social and recreation club.
